content: The "Rural Broadband Infrastructure Investment Act" is cited as the short title. It amends the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 to include a new section on regional telecommunications development. The Secretary may give preference to a telephone loan application supporting telecommunications services on a multijurisdictional basis. Factors considered include collaboration with multiple stakeholders and understanding regional resources. The Rural Electrification Act of 1936 is amended to include clear project objectives with measurable performance measures. Additionally, the definition of a rural area is updated from 5,000 to 20,000 in population size. SEC. 3. RURAL BROADBAND DEVELOPMENT.
